intro: Consolida armeniaca, commonly known as the Armenian cochlearia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of showy, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a nectar source for pollinators.
